title: caffe2 install undefined references to nccl
body_html:
When I'm trying to install caffe2 from source on 18.04, I've been getting some errors involving finding nccl when it should just be using the third party nccl.

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): From source using the command FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install. I followed the instructions, here https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04
  • PyTorch version: master (torch-0.5.0a0+b885dea) essentially. More precisely, that #10665 was used. It's a 1 line commit, but that 1 line was needed for gcc 7 or else I'd get an error on it.
  • Python version: 3.6.5
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.2/7.2.1
  • GPU models and configuration: 1080 Ti x 4
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 7.3.0
  • CMake version: 3.10.2
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries: I didn't install nccl separately so it should just be using the third party nccl. USE_NCCL was on and USE_SYSTEM_NCCL was off in the cmake output.

body_text:
When I'm trying to install caffe2 from source on 18.04, I've been getting some errors involving finding nccl when it should just be using the third party nccl.

PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): From source using the command FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install. I followed the instructions, here https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile
Build command you used (if compiling from source): FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install
OS: Ubuntu 18.04
PyTorch version: master (torch-0.5.0a0+b885dea) essentially. More precisely, that #10665 was used. It's a 1 line commit, but that 1 line was needed for gcc 7 or else I'd get an error on it.
Python version: 3.6.5
CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.2/7.2.1
GPU models and configuration: 1080 Ti x 4
GCC version (if compiling from source): 7.3.0
CMake version: 3.10.2
Versions of any other relevant libraries: I didn't install nccl separately so it should just be using the third party nccl. USE_NCCL was on and USE_SYSTEM_NCCL was off in the cmake output.

The bottom of the cmake output around the error looks like:

body:
When I'm trying to install caffe2 from source on 18.04, I've been getting some errors involving finding nccl when it should just be using the third party nccl.

- PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): From source using the command FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install. I followed the instructions, here https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install
- OS: Ubuntu 18.04
- PyTorch version: master (torch-0.5.0a0+b885dea) essentially. More precisely, that https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/10665 was used. It's a 1 line commit, but that 1 line was needed for gcc 7 or else I'd get an error on it.
- Python version: 3.6.5
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.2/7.2.1
- GPU models and configuration: 1080 Ti x 4
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 7.3.0
- CMake version: 3.10.2
- Versions of any other relevant libraries: I didn't install nccl separately so it should just be using the third party nccl. USE_NCCL was on and USE_SYSTEM_NCCL was off in the cmake output.
